definitions: A surgical procedure in which a small incision is made and an endoscope is inserted to view the area and perform the surgery, often resulting in less pain and a shorter recovery time than traditional open surgery.
Minimally invasive surgery performed using specialized instruments inserted through small incisions, guided by a camera.
examples: Keyhole surgery has revolutionized many medical fields.
Recovery from keyhole surgery is typically faster.
She underwent keyhole surgery for her knee injury.
